name: paper-drip-client
description: Client side for Paper Drip, an origami community app

scripts.test: echo Sorry, no test function yet! Try 'yarn about' for help on commands.
scripts.about: echo Use the about:suffix notation to find out more about packages or scripts. For example, type yarn about:help for options.
scripts.about:help: echo Current suffixes: :help :info :start :build :babel :webpack :yarn :react :sass && echo For more commands, check the README.
scripts.about:info: echo Why is everything unnecessarily thorough? && echo These scripts are here to keep track of what the code does in a human-readable way for newbie developers like me. && echo For more information about the package itself, check out the README file!
scripts.about:babel: echo Babel core: main Babel package, a JavaScript compiler && echo Babel client: allows compilation from CLI && echo Env and React: compiles ES6, React and JSX respectively into more traditional JavaScript.
scripts.about:webpack: echo Webpack: a module bundler && echo Babel, CSS and Sass Loaders: loaders used in Webpack to configure different file types. && echo Webpack Client: allows for CLI commands for WP.
scripts.about:yarn: echo Yarn: package manager && echo Yarn was chosen over NPM for front end due to its higher dependency download speed.
scripts.about:react: echo React: UI framework && echo React was chosen due to familiarity. However, it requires :babel and :webpack to properly compile. && echo React-DOM: provides DOM-specific methods for top level of app.
scripts.about:sass: echo Dart Sass: a CSS extension language && echo Chosen for Webpack utility and powerful features over plain CSS.
scripts.about:start: echo Runs the development server off build MEMORY (notice no dist pops up) at port 3000.
scripts.about:build: echo Bundles the app into a /dist folder.

author: Erin Han
